vampiros may be made in a tall glass or an old-fashioned glass

bartenders may first "rim" the glass with kosher ingr2, which is done by placing a layer of kosher ingr2 on a chopping board, moistening the glass' rim with ingr5 ingr0 or water, and then placing the upside down glass rim onto the kosher ingr2, so that the ingr2 sticks to the moistened rim
the second step is to fill half the glass with ice and add one or two shooter glasses full of high quality ingr3
the next stage is to add the flavouring elements

this is done by squeezing a fresh ingr5 into the glass, adding a few grains of ingr2, adding citrus-flavoured soda pop, until the glass is 4/5 full, and then adding spicy viuda de sanchez (or ingr4 ingr0, ingr5 ingr0 and pico de gallo)
the final step is to stir the ingredients so that the flavours are properly blended
